articles.title: Solidarity with Korean People's Struggle Expressed by Angolan President
articles.content:
Solidarity with Korean People's Struggle Expressed by Angolan President 
    Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Angola expresses invariable support and firm solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle to build a great prosperous powerful nation and reunify the country independently and peacefully, true to the great Songun policy. Angolan President Jose Eduardo Dos Santos said this when receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador to his country Ri Won Son on November 1.
 The two countries have long developed the fraternal relations of friendship and cooperation, the president said, adding that Angola would in the future, too, further expand and develop these relations in all fields including politics and economy.

Greetings to Austrian Federal Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Austrian Federal Foreign Minister 
    Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Ursula Plassnik upon his appointment as federal foreign minister of the Republic of Austria.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished him great success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Ugandan Government Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Ugandan Government Delegation 
    Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the government delegation of Uganda led by Amama Mbabazi, minister of Defence of Uganda, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Sunday.
 At the meeting the head of the delegation said it is a tragedy that a homogeneous nation lives separated, adding that he fully supports the Korean people in their struggle for country's reunification.    
 He wished the army and people of the DPRK closely rallied around leader Kim Jong Il greater success in the future.

articles.title: Congratulations to President of Botswana
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Botswana 
    Pyongyang, November 7 (KCNA) -- President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK Kim Yong Nam on Nov. 5 sent a message of greetings to Festus G. Mogae upon his reelection as president of the Republic of Botswana.
 Expressing belief that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation existing between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his responsible work.

Halt to Negotiations for Opening Rice Market Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Halt to Negotiations for Opening Rice Market Demanded in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Representatives of five peasants organizations of south Korea including the south Korean Federation of Peasants Associations went on a hunger strike at the citizens' park of Kwanghwamun in Seoul on November 1, demanding a halt to the "government's" negotiations for opening the rice market, south Korean KBS reported.
 They declared that they would go on a hunger strike for an indefinite period in protest against the negotiations for opening the rice market the "government" is holding with nine countries including the United States, saying that it is seriously threatening the life of the people.    
 They also said that peasants from across south Korea would gather to hold a large rally on Nov. 13.

Ugandan Government Delegation Here
articles.content:
Ugandan Government Delegation Here
    Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- A Ugandan government delegation led by Minister of Defence Amama Mbabazi arrived here today.
 It was met at the airport by Kim Jong Gak, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and generals and officers of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Government Delegation of Democratic Congo Arrives
articles.content:
Government Delegation of Democratic Congo Arrives
    Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- A government delegation of the Democratic Republic of Congo led by Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation Raymond Ramazani Baya arrived here today.
 It was met at the airport by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Choe Su Hon and officials concerned.

articles.title: Talks between Foreign Ministers of DPRK and Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Talks between Foreign Ministers of DPRK and Democratic Congo
    Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK and Raymond Ramazani Baya, minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Democratic Congo, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 At the talks both sides informed each other of the situation of their countries and exchanged views on further developing friendly relations between the two countries and a series of matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: Indonesian Defence Ministry Delegation Here
articles.content:
Indonesian Defence Ministry Delegation Here
    Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Defence Ministry of Indonesia headed by Maj. General Sudrajat, director general for Defence Strategy, arrived here Saturday.
 The delegation was greeted at the airport by general officers and officers of the Korean People's Army and the Indonesian ambassador e.p. to the DPRK and embassy officials.
